column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=The heat source for the engine has been aforestated to be solar energy.
#Text=For remote sites, solar ponds 37 collect and store the sun's energy in the fluid of the solar pond 37, and the heated fluid of the solar pond 37 becomes the heated fluid 1.

#Text=As shown in FIG. 4, the working fluid 3 is circulated through heat transfer means 6 immersed within the heated fluid 1 of the solar pond 37 where the working fluid 3 is vaporized and pressurized and circulated to the engine.
#Text=In this configuration, the thermostat 34 would be situated to sense the temperature of the heated fluid 1 in the solar pond.
#Text=FIG. 5 shows the solar energy being collected by standard collectors 38.
#Text=The heated fluid 1 is circulated through the collectors 38 by thermal syphoning controlled by a check valve 41 in a return line 42.
#Text=The heated fluid 1 passes from the top of the collectors 38 to a tank 4 through a line 66.
#Text=The heat transfer means 6 is comprised of the tank 4 in which the heated fluid 1 is circulated, and a series of tubes through which the working medium 3 is circulated.

#Text=The operating temperature of the heat transfer means 6, especially if the heated fluid 1 is water, can be increased by pressurizing the tank 4 with compressed air on the top of the tank 4 to prevent boiling of the heated fluid 1.
#Text=The tank 4 has a filler cap 59 into which additional fluid 1 may be introduced if necessary.

#Text=The tubes which carry the working fluid 3 discharge the working fluid 3 in a vaporized state past the pressure switch 13, through the pressure valve 8, through the three-way valves 14 and 18 and into the engine of FIG. 1 or 3.
#Text=If the pressure of the working medium 3 is not sufficient, the pressure switch 13 closes the pressure valve 8 until such time as the pressure of the working medium 3 is sufficient.
#Text=If the temperature of the heated fluid 1 is insufficient, the thermostat 34 will function to close the two-way pressure valve 8 in a similar fashion.
#Text=The circuit through which the heated fluid 1 passes, from collector 38 to tank 4 through the check valve 41 and back to the collector 38, is designated the heat loop 10.
#Text=While the solar powered heat engine works quite satisfactorily, two areas need addressing.
#Text=First, the piston 16 in the cylinder 15 needs lubricating, as does piston 28.
#Text=To accomplish this, oil is introduced into the working medium 3 before the working medium 3 is introduced into the cylinder 15.
#Text=The oil is put into the working medium 3 in the heat transfer means 6, and the oil is entrained by the working medium 3 and transported into the cylinder 15 where the piston 16 is lubricated.
#Text=Excess oil remains entrained and is exhausted with the working medium 3.
#Text=To prevent an excess build-up of oil in the condenser, it is important that the exhausted working medium 3 have a downward path until it is reintroduced into the heat transfer means 6.
#Text=The second area of improvement concerns leakage of the working medium 3 around the piston rod 17.

#Text=It has been found that a certain amount of working medium 3 sometimes is able to leak from the cylinder 15 around the seal to the piston rod 17 which protrudes forth from the cylinder 15 to operate the hydraulic pump 33.

#Text=To solve this problem, the hydraulic pump 33 is made integral with the cylinder 15 and the hydraulic system is pressurized by accumulators 91 on both sides of the piston in the hydraulic pump 33.

#Text=Thus, the minimum pressure on the hydraulic pump 33 is approximately the same as the maximum pressure inside the cylinder 15, and the working medium 3 in the cylinder 15 does not tend to leak out of cylinder 15 against an equal pressure.
#Text=In order to increase the efficiency of the collectors 38, a tracking device 43 is necessary.
#Text=The tracking device 43 should be self-controlling, self-propelling, and self-powered.
#Text=FIG. 6 shows the tracking device 43 to have a platform 44 which has a plurality of wheels 45 canted so that the platform 44 will move in a circular path.

#Text=In the center of the circular path of the wheels 45, is a center post 46 which protrudes vertically from the ground in which the center post 46 is anchored, said center post 46 having on its uppermost extremity, a rigidly affixed horizontal sprocket, designated the hub sprocket 47.
#Text=Affixed to the platform 44 are two mounting posts 49 on each of which is mounted in a horizontal plane an idler sprocket 48.
#Text=The mounting posts 49 are mounted radially from the center post 46 approximately halfway to the wheels 45, and the mounting posts 49 are separated by approximately ninety degrees.
#Text=A chain 50 mates with the hub sprocket 47 and the idler sprockets 48 and is affixed at each end to a piston rod 51 between the idler sprockets 48.
#Text=The piston rod 51 is connected fixedly to a piston 53 which slideably moves within a double acting cylinder 52.
#Text=The cylinder 52 is fixedly mounted to the platform 44, and the cylinder 52 is connected and biased to the piston rod 51 by an east return spring 54.
#Text=The tracking device 43 has two separate trarking collectors 55.
#Text=Each of the tracking collectors 55 is connected by lines 57 to small boilers 56, thus forming loops through which heated fluid 1 circulates by thermal syphoning.
#Text=In each small boiler 56 is an inner tank 61 which contains the working fluid 3.
#Text=Each inner tank 61 is connected by a line 60 to a different end of the double acting cylinder 52.
#Text=The tracking collectors 55 are mounted edge to edge, and separated by a shadow wall 62.
#Text=The collectors 38 are also mounted on the platform 44 perpendicular to the shadow wall 62, and, thus, are aimed at the sun whenever the shadow wall 62 is aimed at the sun.
#Text=The tracking collectors 55 may be in the same plane and parallel to the collectors 38, or may be positioned to form equal acute angles with the shadow wall 62 away from the sun, as shown.
#Text=During the night, the pressure in the cylinder 52 is nearly atmospheric, and the east return spring 54 has moved the platform 44 so that the platform 44 rests against an east stop 63.
#Text=As the sun rises, it begins to heat the tracking collector 55 nearest the sun, but the other tracking collector 55 is shaded by the shadow wall 62.

#Text=The heat from the sun falling on the one tracking collector 55 heats the fluid 1 which, in turn, vaporizes and pressurizes the working medium 3, increasing the pressure in one end of the double acting cylinder 52, thus, the platform 44 is kept against the east stop 63.
#Text=As the sun rises higher, the initially shaded tracking collector 55 is illuminated while the first illuminated tracking collector 55 begins to be shaded.

#Text=The pressure in the other end of the double acting cylinder 52 soon exceeds the pressure in the first pressurized end of the double acting cylinder 52 and causes the cylinder 52 to move with respect to the piston rod 51 and consequently the platform 44 to move.
#Text=As the sun moves from east to west, the platform also moves so that the shadow wall 62 is aimed at the sun and both tracking collectors 55 are illuminated equally.
#Text=Finally, when the sun is setting, the platform 44 comes to rest against a west stop 64.

#Text=As the pressures in the double acting cylinder 52 subside during the night, the east return spring 54 repositions the platform 44 against the east stop 63 so that the collectors 38 and the tracking collectors 55 are awaiting the next sunrise.
#Text=As shown, the tracking device 43 discloses a two fluid system; however, the tracking device 43 could as well be a single fluid system.

#Text=It is contemplated that, for some applications, the engine may be mounted on the platform 44, and in other applications, the engine may be mounted on the ground while the collectors 38 are mounted on the platform 44.
#Text=If the collectors 38 are mounted on the platform 44 and the engine is mounted on the ground, then the lines 42 and 66 will have to be flexible.
#Text=In areas in which there is an appreciable amount of snowfall during the winter, the platform 44 must be elevated.
#Text=Snow accumulations caused from normal snowfall or from snow which slides from the collectors 38 and 55 can prevent the canted wheels 45 from turning.
#Text=This condition can be eliminated by placing a track 78 as shown in FIG. 6 above the ground for the wheels 45 to run on.
#Text=Such a track 78 can be made of angle iron or cement, and should be elevated sufficiently so that snow accumulations do not interfere with the turning of the wheels 45.
